alert.note: Alert for Hancock (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Beaver and Butler. Portions of the northern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following county, Hancock. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cranberry, Weirton, Butler, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Economy, Ellwood City, Ambridge, Homeacre-Lyndora, New Brighton, Shanor-Northvue, Beaver, Baden, Meridian, Zelienople, Rochester, Ohioville, Harmony Township and Meadowood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
